item.title: Kris add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The most pathetic person in the world is some one who has sight but no vision." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kris add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kris add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kris add a quote by Charlie Chaplin
item.description: "Words are cheap. The biggest thing you can say is 'elephant'." -- Charlie Chaplin

item.title: Kris add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The greatest enemy of clear language is insincerity." -- George Orwell

item.title: Kris add a quote by Jim MORRISON
item.description: "The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are. You trade in your reality for a role. You trade in your sense for an act. You give up your ability to feel, and in exchange, put on a mask. There can't be any large-scale revolution until there's a personal revolution, on an individual level. It's got to happen inside first." -- Jim MORRISON

item.title: Kris add a quote by Martha Graham
item.description: "The only sin is mediocrity." -- Martha Graham

item.title: Kris add a quote by H.P. Lovecraft
item.description: "From even the greatest of horrors irony is seldom absent." -- H.P. Lovecraft

item.title: Kris add a quote by Bret Easton Ellis
item.description: "Disappear here" -- Bret Easton Ellis

item.title: Kris add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Sometimes you have to be a high-riding bitch to survive. Sometimes being a bitch is all a woman has to hold onto." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kris add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "A little rebellion is good now and then." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Kris add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "The high-minded man must care more for the truth than for what people think." -- Aristotle

item.title: Kris add a quote by Adolf Hitler
item.description: "If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!" -- Adolf Hitler

item.title: Kris add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Do not waste your time on Social Questions. What is the matter with the poor is Poverty what is the matter with the rich is Uselessness." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Kris add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "Going so soon? I wouldn't hear of it. Why my little party's just beginning. ~ Wicked Witch of the West Wizard of Oz" -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Kris add a quote by adolf hitler
item.description: "If you tell a big enough lie and tell it frequently enough, it will be believed." -- adolf hitler

item.title: Kris add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "The mind, placed before any kind of difficulty, can find an ideal outlet in the absurd. Accommodation to the absurd readmits adults to the mysterious realm inhabited by children." -- Andre Breton

item.title: Kris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kris add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kris add a quote by john lennon
item.description: "We all shine on...like the moon and the stars and the sun...we all shine on...come on and on and on..." -- john lennon

item.title: Kris add a quote by Harry Houdini
item.description: "Magic is the sole science not accepted by scientists, because they can't understand it." -- Harry Houdini

item.title: Kris add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "It's a disease. Nobody thinks or feels or cares any more; nobody gets excited or believes in anything except their own comfortable little God damn mediocrity." -- Richard Yates
